page.title: 03A King's Gift.
page.content: The{South Inch}was given to Perth people in 1377 by{Robert 111.}Its uses ranged from grazing land to the site of a fort for {Oliver Cromwell; from bleaching linen and drying wash_ ing to racing horses, archery and golf.Three{witches}were burnt there in 1598.{Plague victims }lived on it in the mid_17th century and in 1845 pro_ testing citizens prevented {Railway Companies building a{terminus}on it. Today Perth people and thousands of visitors enjoy its beauty.There is a boating - pond, paddling pool, putting and bowling green, swings and climbing frame. Football, hockey and shinty are played there in the winter. In August an{ Agricultural Show}is held on the {Little Inch,}which is also used for circuses, travelling- fairs and a bon- fire and fireworks display on Nov.5. We treasure our{Royal gift.
